title: Calories in IPA Ale
meta_description: Discover calories in IPA ale per standard serving, including carbs, alcohol impact, and variations by brand or style for better tracking.
assumptions: Standard 12 oz (355 ml) bottle of India Pale Ale, ~6.5% ABV, craft-brewed with typical hops and malt; no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, brewing method, and serving size. Check labels or brewery info for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 12 oz serving of IPA ale contains about 215 kcal, mostly from carbs and alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to light IPA (lower ABV and carbs)

faqs.q: How many calories in a 12 oz IPA ale?
faqs.a: Approximately 215 kcal for a standard serving.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in IPA ale?
faqs.a: Primarily carbohydrates from malt (~14 g) and alcohol (~6.5% ABV).

faqs.q: Are there carbs in IPA ale?
faqs.a: Yes, about 14 g per 12 oz serving, with minimal fiber or sugars.

faqs.q: How does IPA compare to regular beer calories?
faqs.a: IPAs are often higher (200-250 kcal) due to more hops and alcohol than lighter lagers (100-150 kcal).

faqs.q: Does serving size affect calories in IPA ale?
